name: micelle
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a group of molecules (= the simplest forms of a chemical substance) that is found in certain solutions (= liquids into which a solid has been mixed and dissolved), for example soap solutions: The new molecules cluster together to form a micelle.
More examplesFewer examplesTypically, a micelle consists of 60-200 monomers.The particle, called a “micelle” and made up of a cluster of molecules called aptamers, easily recognizes tumours and binds strongly to them. Plasmid DNA can be covered with lipids in an organized structure like a micelle or a liposome.
